alert.note: Alert for Oconee; Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 2:14PM EDT until September 04 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by heavy rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Oconee and Pickens. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 210 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain showers continuing to move over eastern Oconee County, particularly in Seneca and vicinity. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area, especially in flood prone and poor drainage areas around Seneca. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible over the area this afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seneca, Walhalla, Salem, Lake Keowee, Devils Fork State Park, Lake Jocassee, Lake Hartwell and Townville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
